calculate_industry_relevance(company_industry, case_study_industry)[source]

Calculate relevance between a company’s industry and a case study’s industry.

Parameters:

  • company_industry (str) – Industry of the company

  • case_study_industry (str) – Industry mentioned in the case study

Returns:

Relevance score between 0 and 5

Return type:

int

Calculate location relevance based on country or region proximity.

Parameters:

  • company_location (str) – Location of the company

  • case_study_location (str) – Location from the case study

Returns:

Location relevance score (0-3)

Return type:

int

Score company size relevance to case study indicators.

Parameters:

  • company_size – str, e.g. “51-200”

  • target_sizes – list of str

Returns:

int score from 0 to 5

Calculate a comprehensive solution relevance score using multiple factors.

Parameters:

  • company_info (dict) – Dictionary containing company details

  • case_study_info (dict) – Dictionary containing case study details

Returns:

Dictionary with total score and component scores

dict

Parameters:

  • company_info (dict) – Dictionary containing company information

  • case_study_info (dict) – Dictionary containing case study information

Extracts an ‘about’-like section from a company’s homepage, only if the detected language is English.

Returns:

str or None

extract_case_study_info(case_study_text)[source]

Extract comprehensive information from case study text.

Parameters:

case_study_text – str, full text of the case study

Returns:

dict with extracted info: industry, location, solution details, tech keywords, and company size indicators

filter_companies_from_dynamodb(table, case_study_info, min_score=30)[source]

Query and filter companies from a DynamoDB table based on a case study and relevance scoring.

This function scans a DynamoDB table to retrieve company profiles and filters them based on their relevance to the provided case study using multiple dimensions (industry, size, tech, and location). Relevance is computed using a composite score. Optionally applies an initial filter on industry before falling back to a full table scan.

Parameters:

  • table (boto3.resources.factory.dynamodb.Table) – DynamoDB table resource (boto3 Table)

  • case_study_info (dict) – Information about the case study used for scoring relevance

  • min_score (int) – Minimum total relevance score for a company to be included

Returns:

List of company dicts with total and individual relevance scores, sorted by total score

Return type:

list[dict]

map_case_study_size_to_company_size(case_size_indicators)[source]

Map qualitative size indicators to employee count categories.

Parameters:

case_size_indicators – list or str

Returns:

list of size categories

normalize_text(text)[source]

Normalize text for better matching.

Parameters:

text – str

Returns:

str, lowercased and whitespace-normalized

parse_employee_count(size_str)[source]

Convert size strings to numerical employee ranges.

Parameters:

size_str – str, e.g. “1-10”

Returns:

tuple (min, max)

process_case_study(case_study_text)[source]

Process a case study text, retrieve and filter relevant companies, and find a target company with available about information.

This function extracts information from a case study, queries DynamoDB for matching companies, and processes each company to find one with retrievable information about the company. The results are logged, and the details of the selected company are returned.

Parameters:

case_study_text (str) – The text of the case study to process

Returns:

A tuple containing: - A list of strings representing the logged output during the processing - A list of company details (name, industry, size, country, website)

Return type:

tuple[list[str], list[str]]

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during processing (e.g., network failure, DynamoDB issue)

scrape_company_website(company)[source]

Scrapes a company website to extract about information.

Parameters:

company – dict containing ‘website’ and ‘name’ keys

Returns:

dict with ‘website’ and ‘about_info’

select_target_companies(matching_companies, min_score=40)[source]

Select and return companies that exceed a specified score threshold.

This function filters out companies from a list of matching candidates based on a higher score threshold for use in targeted actions (e.g., outreach, partnership). Falls back to returning all matching companies if none meet the minimum threshold.

Parameters:

  • matching_companies (list[dict]) – List of companies with scored relevance

  • min_score (int) – Minimum score threshold for inclusion in final selection

Returns:

Filtered list of companies with scores >= min_score

Return type:

list[dict]

Outreach_System_Functions.data_function_doc module

embed_text_titan(text_list)[source]

Generate text embeddings for a list of documents using Amazon Titan via AWS Bedrock.

This function attempts to embed each text in the input list. If an embedding cannot be generated for a particular entry, its index is added to a list of failures.

Parameters:

text_list (list of str) – A list of text strings to embed.

Returns:

list: A list of embedding vectors (lists of floats) for successfully processed texts. list: A list of indices for texts that failed to embed.

Return type:

tuple

extract_casetudy_link(text)[source]

Extract the first URL from the given text using a regular expression pattern.

Parameters:

text (str) – The text potentially containing a URL.

Returns:

The first matched URL if found, otherwise “None”.

Return type:

str

extract_location_with_claude(text)[source]

Extract the country in which a case study is based using Claude via AWS Bedrock.

This function first looks for explicit location hints in the text, then uses a language model to infer the country based on both the full case study content and the extracted hints.

Parameters:

text (str) – The full case study text, potentially including location hints.

Returns:

The name of the identified country (e.g., “Germany”, “South Africa”).

Returns “Unknown” if the location cannot be confidently determined.

Return type:

str

get_bedrock_client()[source]

Create and return a Bedrock Runtime client for the AWS region ‘eu-central-1’.

Returns:

An AWS Bedrock Runtime client configured for the ‘eu-central-1’ region.

Return type:

boto3.client

identify_industry(text)[source]

Identify the primary industry relevant to the given text.

First attempts to extract the industry from a line explicitly stating it. If not found, uses an LLM via AWS Bedrock to determine the most relevant industry from a predefined list of candidates.

Parameters:

text (str) – The input text from which to determine the industry.

Returns:

The identified industry label from the candidate list,

or “Unknown” if it cannot be determined.

Return type:

str

main()[source]

Main execution function to process case study documents from S3, extract metadata, generate embeddings using Amazon Titan, and index them into an OpenSearch cluster.

Workflow: 1. Connects to OpenSearch using provided credentials. 2. Lists all .docx files from a specified S3 bucket and prefix. 3. Filters out documents already indexed in OpenSearch. 4. For each new document:

  • Downloads and reads text content.

  • Identifies industry and location using Claude.

  • Extracts solution summary and source link.

  • Prepares metadata and stores documents locally.

  1. Generates vector embeddings for each document using Amazon Titan.

  2. Creates a new OpenSearch index if it doesn’t exist.

  3. Indexes each document into OpenSearch along with its embedding and metadata.

Raises:

Any exceptions are caught and printed during processing, embedding, and indexing. –

summarize_solution_with_claude(text)[source]

Summarize a case study using a structured format via Claude on AWS Bedrock.

The summary includes: - Challenge: The problem addressed. - Approach: How the problem was solved. - Impact: The results or benefits achieved.

Parameters:

text (str) – The full text of the case study to be summarized.

Returns:

A structured summary of the case study, or a fallback message if summarization fails.

Return type:

str

animatePrint(text, speed=70)[source]

Print text with a typewriter-style animation to the terminal.

This function prints each character of the text with a delay between them, preventing text dumps in the terminal and aiding in readability when displaying content, especially for longer text.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The text to animate.

  • speed (int, optional) – Characters per second, defaults to 70.

Parameters:

  • caseStudyDetails (str) – Case study text describing Elixirr’s previous engagement.

  • targetCompanyDetails (str) – Insights or notes about the target company.

  • verbose (bool) – If True, animates the output.

Returns:

A structured email object.

  • changes (str) – Textual description of the desired changes.

Outreach_System_Functions.uploadNewCaseStudy module

uploadCaseStudy(content, filename)[source]

Creates a .docx file from the given content and uploads it to an S3 bucket.

The function creates a Word document using the python-docx library, writes each line of content as a new paragraph, saves it locally with the specified filename, and uploads it to the given S3 bucket and prefix using the boto3 client.

Parameters:

  • content (str) – The text content to be written to the .docx file. Each line will become a new paragraph.

  • filename (str) – The base filename (without extension) to use for the local file and the S3 object.

Raises:

  • BotoCoreError – If a low-level error occurs in the boto3 library while communicating with AWS.

  • ClientError – If a client-level error occurs, such as authentication or permission issues.

Returns:

None
